DOC.brief_summary: The objective study examine impact home-based peer support intervention mother affect postpartum depression ( PPD ) infant .
DOC.brief_title: Trial Evaluate Effect Home-Based Peer Support Maternal-Infant Interaction , Infant Health Outcomes , Postpartum Depression ( PPD )
DOC.detailed_description: This control study help establish link support maternal caregiving , maternal-infant interaction , infant neuroendocrinology infant cognitive social development . The primary hypothesis predict home-based peer support improve maternal-infant interaction . Secondary hypothesis predict home-based peer support : improve infant ' cognitive development ; improve infant ' social development ; decrease average daily salivary cortisol level infant ; reduce maternal depressive symptomatology ; improve maternal perception social support .
DOC.criteria: Eligible mother identify experience symptom PPD score > 12 Edinburgh Postnatal Depression Scale . Mothers must speak English French . Mothers exclude take antidepressant antipsychotic medication , use intervention PPD , report history mental illness ; The infant must fullterm , care mother 3 6 month age initial enrollment .
